thread.title: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution targeted by cyberattack - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution targeted by cyberattack - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution targeted by cyberattack - Massachusetts news
text:
FALMOUTH, Mass. (AP) — The Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution says it’s been the victim of a cyberattack that targeted trade secrets stemming from the nonprofit lab’s research activity.
The Cape Cod Times (http://bit.ly/1GOLwpK ) reports that officials told staff about the attack in a memo last week after it shut down its network and asked employees to reset their passwords.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The institution’s vice president for legal affairs says an investigation showed its systems were accessed as far back as February 2013. The hack went unnoticed until June, when the institution’s tech team detected unusual activity from its network to outbound servers.
The federal government and law enforcement have been working to investigate. Initial indications are that an ‘‘advanced persistent threat’’ group based in China is responsible. There is no evidence classified information was compromised.
___
Information from: Cape Cod (Mass.) Times, http://www.capecodonline.com
